anyOrder

anyOrder: ((subScriptList: AnnotatedSubscript[]) => AnyOrderContainer)

Type declaration

    • (subScriptList: AnnotatedSubscript[]): AnyOrderContainer

    • Wrap a list of patterns indicating that the order does not matter.

      For example:

      B.checkBlocks(e, current, [
        {
          pattern: forever(anything()),
          feedback: {
            correct: 'De planeet kan oneindig lang bewegen.',
            wrong: 'Planeet moet oneindig lang bewegen.',
          },
          subgroup: false,
          name: 'Juiste lus',
          substack: [
            {
              name: 'Naar muis richten',
              pattern: pointTowards('_mouse_'),
              feedback: {
                correct: 'De planeet richt zich naar de muis.',
                wrong: 'De planeet moet zich eerst naar de muis richten.',
              },
            },
            {
              name: 'Bewegen',
              pattern: moveXSteps(5),
              feedback: {
                correct: 'De planeet zet 5 stappen.',
                wrong: 'Nadien moet de planeet 5 stappen nemen.',
              },
            },
            B.anyOrder([
              {
                name: 'Snelheid veranderen',
                pattern: procedureCall('Verander snelheid volgens grootte'),
                feedback: {
                  correct: 'De planeet verandert zijn snelheid.',
                  wrong: 'De planeet moet zijn snelheid veranderen.',
                },
              },
              {
                name: 'Grootte veranderen',
                pattern: procedureCall('Maak me groter of kleiner wanneer ik object raak'),
                feedback: {
                  correct: 'De planeet verandert zijn grootte.',
                  wrong: 'De planeet moet zijn grootte veranderen.',
                },
              },
            ]),
          ],
        },
      ]);

      Parameters

      • subScriptList: AnnotatedSubscript[]

      Returns AnyOrderContainer

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:279

anything

anything: (() => Anything)

Type declaration

    • (): Anything

    • Match any value or block.

      No block or no value is not included in this, i.e. null or undefined blocks or values are not accepted with anything.

      Returns Anything

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:153

checkBlocks

checkBlocks: ((e: Evaluation, startNode: undefined | null | Node, subScriptList: (AnnotatedSubscript | AnyOrderContainer)[]) => void)

Type declaration

    • (e: Evaluation, startNode: undefined | null | Node, subScriptList: (AnnotatedSubscript | AnyOrderContainer)[]): void

    • A function to check orderless subscripts.

      Normally, you would use checkBlocks to verify the blocks in a certain script, with an optional grouping of the tests.

      With this function, you can do the same but further allow parts to be in a random order.

      This is mostly useful if a bunch of blocks in a loop needs to be executed, without regard to the order in which they are executed, as long as they are executed once.

      Parameters

      • e: Evaluation
      • startNode: undefined | null | Node
      • subScriptList: (AnnotatedSubscript | AnyOrderContainer)[]

      Returns void

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:278

nodeMatchesPattern

nodeMatchesPattern: ((node: undefined | null | Node, pattern: Pattern<PatternBlock>) => boolean)

Type declaration

    • (node: undefined | null | Node, pattern: Pattern<PatternBlock>): boolean

    • Check if a node matches with a pattern.

      This only checks the current node (and its children), but not the next node (since you can also only pass one pattern).

      Parameters

      • node: undefined | null | Node

        The node to match.

      • pattern: Pattern<PatternBlock>

        The pattern to match the node to.

      Returns boolean

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:274

procedureCall

procedureCall: ((...additionalArguments: ValuePattern<string | number | BooleanBlock>[]) => PatternBlock)

Type declaration

    • (...additionalArguments: ValuePattern<string | number | BooleanBlock>[]): PatternBlock

    • Match against a procedure call.

      The arguments of the procedure call should be given in-order, including any labels or names of the procedure. Every argument supports all pattern-related features.

      See

      https://en.scratch-wiki.info/wiki/My_Blocks

      Parameters

      • Rest ...additionalArguments: ValuePattern<string | number | BooleanBlock>[]

      Returns PatternBlock

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:213

procedureDefinition

procedureDefinition: ((mutation: ValuePattern<string>) => PatternBlock)

Type declaration

    • (mutation: ValuePattern<string>): PatternBlock

    • Match against a procedure definition.

      The mutation should be a space-separated string, consisting of:

      • The literal names for labels and procedure names.
      • %n for numbers
      • %s for strings
      • %b for booleans

      See

      https://en.scratch-wiki.info/wiki/My_Blocks

      Parameters

      • mutation: ValuePattern<string>

        The mutation string, see above.

      Returns PatternBlock

  • Defined in packages/core/src/global.d.ts:215
